author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> We are currently not verifying the transcript file on load. In fact, we don't have functionality to verify transcripts (as opposed to contributions). Is this desirable? (I started something here: https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-sequencer/pull/120)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> Other than that I don't see any open issues, what are the next steps for the ceremony?

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  If you can guarantee that the state of the transcript on each load, even after crashing is  correct, then I think its okay, though not desirable (re @Recmo: We are currently not verifying the transcript file on load. In fact, we don't have functionality to verify transcripts (as opposed to contributions). Is this desirable? (I started something here: https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-sequencer/pull/120))

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> The process should not corrupt the transcript file, even on crash. So in that sense this would be a no-op.

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> This is more in the category of defense-in-depth, adding extra checks to detect any potential problems early.

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> But my earlier PR along those lines was reverted, so now I'm checking beforehand.

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  I like the PR, the downside is that if the sequencer goes down, then they may take a bit of time to get back up since they'll be checking the entire transcript (re @Recmo: But my earlier PR along those lines was reverted, so now I'm checking beforehand.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> I think you can probably skip signature checks and then just prune invalid signatures when the ceremony ends

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> Good point, this can take quite a bit longer than verifying a contribution.

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> Right now the thing that bothers me is that `participant_ids` and `participant_ecdsa_signatures` and all the contribution `witness`es can have differnt lengths after a corrupt file is loaded. I have no idea how the sequencer will handle that.

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> I can focus on just fixing that, and leave the cryptographic verification for later

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  I don't think there is a way to heal this automatically, because removing participants could be seen as censoring (re @Recmo: Right now the thing that bothers me is that participant_ids and participant_ecdsa_signatures and all the contribution `witness`es can have differnt lengths after a corrupt file is loaded. I have no idea how the sequencer will handle that.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> There's no way to fix that kind of corruption automatically. The idea would be that it refuses to start untill someone manually fixes it.

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  I wonder if the sequencer should back-up the file periodically somewhere on IPFS, or have clients do this for their own transcript ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è (re @Recmo: Right now the thing that bothers me is that participant_ids and participant_ecdsa_signatures and all the contribution `witness`es can have differnt lengths after a corrupt file is loaded. I have no idea how the sequencer will handle that.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> The alternative/current behaviour is to proceed with a corrupt transcript and do something undefined with it (like, crash at some point later or worse, accept contributions as if everything is fine but not produce a valid transcript)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Recmo> I would suggest regular backups of the transcript file. Daily at a minimum. We can even have the sequencer create `transcript-2022-11-04.bak.json`  backup files.

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  Yeah, the lower the interval, the less contributions that get thrown away in the worse case, where you need to just start from a backup (re @Recmo: I would suggest regular backups of the transcript file.
